body: Sought to contrive, intending to expressIn the sound of the snow. What the countlessStunned in their voiceless way to be aliveAt the white place of the road's vanishingto try that, to hold a terrifying beastshaded by live oaks and bottlebrush treesXVIII. The Northeast and Northwest Passageswhose soft bristles graze the top-racks.Beyond ice floe and berg and ice-bound sea,Beneath the snowflakes I notice façadesTo a higher level of appearance.Swaying in unison beneath the snow,Dismal, endless plain—By bloody pool—rattling, gasping his last.Empty streets I come upon by chance,into early blooming. Then, the inevitable blizzardfor a few weeks, statistics won't seemWhiteness, those pediments that riseShadows keep piling up as surfaces
